description: Learn to build modern web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React.

batches.batchDetails: Morning batch from 10 AM to 12 PM, suitable for students and professionals.
Evening batch from 6 PM to 8 PM, designed for working professionals.

prerequisites: Basic understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Experience with Git and version control (recommended)
learningOutcomes: Build responsive web applications using React
Understand RESTful APIs and integrate them into applications
Develop backend services using Node.js and Express
Implement authentication and authorization in web applications
Use modern tools like Docker and CI/CD pipelines

schedule.scheduleDetails: Overview of web development technologies, history of the web, and setting up a development environment.
Building static web pages with HTML and CSS. Understanding the box model, CSS selectors, and responsive design.
Introduction to JavaScript: variables, data types, functions, loops, and DOM manipulation.
Understanding closures, promises, async/await, and advanced DOM manipulation techniques.
Introduction to React: components, state, props, and JSX. Building simple applications with React.
Handling forms, state management with Redux, and React hooks. Building larger-scale applications.
Building server-side applications using Node.js and Express. Understanding middleware and routing.
Creating and consuming RESTful APIs. Working with Postman to test APIs and handling API errors.
Introduction to NoSQL databases, working with MongoDB to store and retrieve data. Understanding CRUD operations.
Implementing user authentication and authorization using JWT and Passport.js. Protecting routes and sessions.
Deploying web applications on cloud platforms such as Heroku, AWS, or Google Cloud. Using Docker for containerization.
Students present their final projects which incorporate all concepts learned throughout the course.

assessments: Final project showcasing a complete web application
Peer code reviews and feedback sessions
targetAudience: Software engineers looking to transition to full-stack development
Anyone interested in building modern web applications
Entrepreneurs looking to build their own tech products

support.officeHours: Weekly on Wednesdays from 3 PM to 5 PM
support.discussionForum: Access to a dedicated forum for questions and discussions
support.emailSupport: 24/7 email support for all enrolled students
support.careerGuidance: Career assistance with job search, resume building, and mock interviews

applicants.applicantDescription: A passionate web developer with a keen interest in learning full stack development.
An aspiring developer seeking to enhance his skills in modern web technologies.
A tech enthusiast eager to learn and build dynamic web applications.
A software engineer transitioning to full-stack development to expand her career.
